revised_title: Surface Lipid Composition of Brassica oleracea Leaves
tldr: The authors analyzed the surface lipid composition of Brassica oleracea (cabbage) leaves and found that nonacosane and its derivatives make up over 60% of its weight. They used gas-liquid chromatography, adsorption, and reversed-phase partition film chromatography to determine the composition of the hydrocarbon fraction and the nonacosane derivatives. This study provides insight into the importance of nonacosane and its derivatives in plant lipids.
